answerText: James Borwell[10] Articles about the wanton Misella and pieces in the form of letters are among the 208 articles Samuel Johnson wrote as part of this periodical.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Chicago A  | 14 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This man quoted Jean-Jacques Rousseau's letters of introduction at the beginning of his Journal of a Tour to Corsica. For 10 points each: [10] Name this author of the poem "No Abolition of Slavery; or the Universal Empire of Love," best known for his chronicle of the man who wrote The Lives of the Most Eminent Poets.
